technology.short_description: As regiments gain renown, their standards become talismans that are just as important as their sword-arms.
State Troops are often issued with armour plate to ensure unit cohesion and a reasonable level of protection.
Thicker plates for riders and scaled barding for their mounts, meaning a greater percentage survive to charge again.
Riding for days whilst bearing full kit increases one's stamina for the real thing.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for cavalry units

technology.short_description: Packing a wallop when they strike, artillery crews are also measured on their firing rates; the faster the better.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: More barrels, more chances to knock enemy blocks clean off â€“ it's simply a matter of arithmetic.

effects.description: Explosive missile damage: +10% for artillery units

technology.short_description: Industrialised production of ammunition for handguns has allowed the Empire to hoard large supplies.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Missile units

technology.short_description: Fixing arms atop mounts and rides does away with the need to dismount and set up prior to firing, in turn reducing vulnerability and increasing efficiency.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units
Missile strength: +10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: Refined ore techniques create stronger steel, making for more durable blades and heavier weapon-heads.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Melee Infantry units
"Imperial Allegiance" melee damage reflection for infantry units

technology.short_description: Although the cost falls to each individual soldier, it is expected that all will use standardised equipment.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Melee Infantry units
Melee defence: +4 for Melee Infantry units

technology.short_description: What a mount cannot see will not spook them, ensuring every charge hits the target squarely.
The Knights of the Inner Circle are the elite of the elite, amongst the best fighting men of the Empire.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Cavalry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: When the enemy might be an enormous monster taller than the highest spire, it's a good idea not to run out of ammo!
Even the largest hulking war machine can be made more resilient to attack.

effects.description: Attribute: Ballistic Plating for Steam Tank units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Clad in heavy plates designed specifically to protect against projectiles, this unit is capable of deflecting even direct cannon fire!

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Steam Tank and Land Ship units
Missile resistance: 10% for Steam Tank and Land Ship units

technology.short_description: Missile units who train together excel at firing a deadly hail, so not all members of a regiment have to see the target.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units

technology.short_description: The discovery of barrel-rifling led to increases in speed and accuracy. Both Dwarfs and men claim credit for this invention.
There's always a new market to be tapped, or a fresh approach to existing ones.
Selective breeding allows the Empire to have good supply of steeds, capable of carrying heavily-armoured Knights into battle.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Empire Knights and Order Knights units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units

technology.short_description: An army can only march as far as its supplies will last. Wagons loaded with goods allow for larger forces.
Being able to share acquired knowledge among your peers can only lead to better results all round.
Interchangeable parts and constant work shifts ensure production targets are met or even exceeded.
The greatest minds of the Old World are gathered by the Empireâ€™s various institutions to impart their knowledge and methods of efficiency.
The Imperial Architects are an eccentric bunch who have always had, well, let's say 'fanciful' ideas about how a building should lookâ€¦
A rebate is a useful tool when things are good to ensure compliance during the hard times inevitably just around the corner.
It's comforting for people to know where their next meal will come from when winter's chill descends.
This joint-stock enterprise, if the trade winds prevail, is bound to make both factors and shareholders filthy, stinking rich. Amen.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +20%

technology.short_description: This progressive assembly enables swifter production of all manner of industrial goods.
The bravest, most-accomplished warriors do not always come from among the nobility, but must get their start somewhere.
One god, one way, many agents to guarantee compliance in defence of the faith.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Warrior Priests

technology.short_description: Lords rule and live well, peasants work themselves to death and must pay for the privilege â€“ it's the perfect model for any truly forward-looking society.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: This colonial campus maintains the high standards taught within the Imperial Colleges of Magic back home.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Empire Captains

technology.short_description: "An eighth of an ounce of this, a pinch of that, and half a pound of the other andâ€¦ Boom! We have ignition!"

effects.description: Missile Explosion Radius: +20% for Artillery units

technology.short_description: A more efficient way of transferring force from gas under pressure speeds up the production process, meaning more steam-powered weapons ready for the fight.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units
Unit mass: +20% for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units
Charge bonus: +20 for Steam Tank, Luminark and Land Ship units

technology.short_description: Intelligence shared is intelligence doubled.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +5 for Witch Hunters

technology.onscreen_name: Emissary to the Prince of Altdorf
technology.short_description: This trusted advisor, whose loyalty is beyond reproach, knows the Emperor's mind almost as well as Karl Franz himself!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms
Gain Military Access with all non-hostile Empire factions

technology.short_description: Successful dealings with the lofty, aloof Asur takes a certain type of individual if awkward diplomatic misunderstandings are to be avoided.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +20

technology.short_description: Diplomatic and discreet, this one knows exactly how to deal with fiery Dwarfen temperaments, so is well placed to run the Imperial embassy to the Everlasting Realm.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.onscreen_name: Ambassador to the Royarch of Bretonnia
technology.short_description: Deferent and respectful, the embassy to Bretonnia understands perfectly the customs and traditions of this ancient feudal society.
Foul Greenskins, flea-infested Skaven, gluttonous Ogres and slimy Lizardmen are abroad in sufficient numbers that an organised cull is now necessary.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: There may be fell Necromancy afoot, for the Undead and Unliving infest Imperial territory in too greater numbers, hastening the need for an immediate purge.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Undead

technology.short_description: These lands belong to the Empire â€“ those arrogant, knife-eared Elves must be driven back to their own dominion, and with haste!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Elves

technology.short_description: The taint of Chaos has been observed here; such things must not be allowed to gain a foothold and be removed without delay!

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +10% for all units when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
